content:
Everyone: We have entered the QA freeze stage of the STU3 release process. We've initiated the process of reviewing the spelling grammar across all resources and pages. The other set of things to review is the technical representations of the specification:
- XML schema
- JSON Schema
- SHEX schema
- RDF representation
- JSON-LD representations
- Reference Implementations
I'm looking for volunteers to review these artifacts. And the volunteer must be someone different from the person who maintains the representations (not for the reference implementations)
What does a QA review of technical representations entail?

well, for validating ones like schema, checking that they validate resources. Manual review that they are representing content correctly, checking that they cover all the resources, checking that they have a clear license sattement
I'll take on schematron. I bought a full license for saxon, may as well make use of it :)
heh and I didn't even list that.
Well .... the schema causing errors in Spy does that count as QA
I meant the form or process for identifying issues during the QA review of technical representations?

Well, if you volunteered, you'll have been given instructions. If you didn't volunteer, then just go ahead and make the edits if you've got commit privileges, staying within the bounds of what's permitted by the freeze.
ok I just fixed the schema errors
